item.title: Jessica add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Diana Tixier Herald
item.description: "No two people ever read the same book." -- Diana Tixier Herald

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Betty Rosenberg
item.description: "Never apologize for your reading tastes." -- Betty Rosenberg

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Terry Goodkind
item.description: "People are stupid. They will believe a lie because they want to believe it's true, or because they are afraid it might be true." -- Terry Goodkind

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Jessica add a quote by A.A. Milne
Jessica add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description:
"Do you understand how amazing it is to hear that from an adult? Do you know how amazing it is to hear that from anybody? It's one of the simplest sentences in the world, just four words, but they're the four hugest words in the world when they're put together.
You can do it." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "We all have to find our own ways to say good-bye." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "My grandmother's greatest gift was tolerance. Now, in the old days, Indians used to be forgiving of any kind of eccentricity. In fact, weird people were often celebrated. Epileptics were often shamans because people just assumed that God gave seizure-visions to the lucky ones. Gay people were seen as magical too. I mean, like in many cultures, men were viewed as warriors and women were viewed as caregivers. But gay people, being both male and female, were seen as both warriors and caregivers. Gay people could do anything. They were like Swiss Army knives! My grandmother had no use for all the gay bashing and homophobia in the world, especially among other Indians. "Jeez," she said, Who cares if a man wants to marry another man? All I want to know is who's going to pick up all the dirty socks?" (155)" -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Grief is when you feel so helpless and stupid that you think nothing will ever be right again, and your macaroni and cheese tastes like sawdust, and you can't even jerk off because it seems like too much trouble. (172)" -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ralph Moody
item.description: "Always remember, Son, the best boss is the one who bosses the least. Whether it's cattle, or horses, or men; the least government is the best government. " -- Ralph Moody

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Ralph Moody
item.description: "There are only two kinds of men in this world: Honest men and dishonest men. ...Any man who says the world owes him a living is dishonest. The same God that made you and me made this earth. And He planned it so that it would yield every single thing that the people on it need. But He was careful to plan it so that it would only yield up its wealth in exchange for the labor of man. Any man who tries to share in that wealth without contributing the work of his brain or his hands is dishonest." -- Ralph Moody

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "There's a lot to be said for being alone. But you and I know, don't we, Flavia, that being alone and being lonely are not at all the same thing?" -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description: "If you remember nothing else, remember this: Inspiration from outside one's self is like the heat in an oven. It makes passable Bath buns. But inspiration from within is like a volcano: It changes the face of the world." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Lee Child
item.description: "You do not mess with the special investigators." -- Lee Child

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Jamie Ford
item.description: "The library is like a candy store where everything is free." -- Jamie Ford
